content.question: Assume the economy is in a short-run equilibrium at point L. In the absence of any fiscal or monetary policy actions, what will happen in the long run?

choices.label: The <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mi>AD</mi></math> curve will shift to the right, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point J.
The <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mi>AD</mi></math> curve will shift to the right, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point M.

The <math alttext="A D" overflow="scroll"><mi>AD</mi></math> curve will shift to the right, the <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"><mi>SRAS</mi></math> curve will shift to the left, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point M.
The <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"><mi>SRAS</mi></math> curve will shift to the left, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point M.
The <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"><mi>SRAS</mi></math> curve will shift to the right, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point K.

content.answer: The <math alttext="S R A S" overflow="scroll"><mi>SRAS</mi></math> curve will shift to the right, and the economy will be in long-run equilibrium at point K.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
